title: Buy HDFC Bank; target of Rs 1,850: ICICI Securities

description: Emkay Global Financial is bullish on Bajaj Finance has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 9000 in its research report dated April 23, 2024.

description: ICICI Direct is bullish on Patel Engineering recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 80 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Accumulate Infosys; target of Rs 1531: KR Choksey
description: KR Choksey recommended Accumulate rating on Infosys with a target price of Rs 1531 in its research report dated April 22, 2024.

title: Sebi modifies Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic trading. Key changes explained
description: Sebi is refining its Order-to-Trade Ratio framework for algorithmic orders, effective April 6, 2026. New exemptions for equity options and specific price bands aim to balance market liquidity with preventing excessive order placement. These changes follow stakeholder input and acknowledge the role of market makers. Separately, Sebi proposed overhauling its 'fit and proper person' rules for intermediaries.

title: Devyani International Q3 Results: Loss widens to Rs 109 crore, revenue up 11%
description: Devyani International Ltd announced a net loss of Rs 109.78 crore for the December quarter of FY26. This marks an increase from the previous year's loss. However, the company saw its revenue from operations rise by 11.31 percent. Its Biryani by Kilo business reached breakeven. Devyani International is a major franchisee for KFC and Pizza Hut in India.

title: Nykaa Q3 Results Preview: PAT may surge up to 192% YoY led by BPC momentum; revenue to rise up to 28%
description: Nykaa is poised for a strong performance in the December quarter. Robust festive demand and sustained momentum in its Beauty and Personal Care segment are expected to drive significant profit growth. Brokerage estimates project a substantial surge in net profit and revenue. The company is set to announce its earnings on Thursday, February 5.

title: Gold, silver or stocks? How Mukesh Ambani believes average Indian saver can compound wealth
description: Mukesh Ambani urged Indians to shift savings from gold and silver into capital markets, arguing that precious metals, though safe, do not create wealth in a fast-growing economy. Speaking at a JioBlackRock event, he said productive investments offer compounding returns, unlike bullion imports that sit idle outside the formal financial system.

title: Indian bonds rise ahead of RBI debt purchase, policy outcome
description: Indian government bonds rose for a second straight session as expectations of continued RBI bond purchases supported sentiment ahead of record FY27 borrowing. The 10-year yield eased to 6.6972%, while markets await the RBI’s policy decision and liquidity outlook. Traders expect no further rate cuts but continued growth-supportive OMO operations.

title: Carlsberg shares rise on profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
description: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

title: Carlsberg shares rise as profit beats forecasts; co mulls Indian IPO
description: Carlsberg reported a 5% rise in full-year operating profit, exceeding forecasts, and is considering an initial public offering for its Indian operations. The brewer also projected 2-6% profit growth for the current year, despite a challenging consumer environment. The potential Indian IPO could significantly reduce the company's debt.

title: 'Idle money in bank accounts doesn't compound': Mukesh Ambani on why Indians should invest in stock market
description: Mukesh Ambani urged Indian households to shift savings from physical assets like gold to capital markets for productive wealth creation. He emphasized simplifying investment access, drawing a parallel to Jio's impact, to democratize participation and fuel economic growth as India enters a powerful expansion phase.

title: Next 20-25 years will be India's era: Blackrock CEO on why the world's biggest asset manager is betting big on Indian investors
description: BlackRock CEO Larry Fink said the next 20–25 years will be the “era of India,” driven by rising domestic investment and rapid technological adoption. Speaking with Mukesh Ambani at a JioBlackRock event, he highlighted deeper household participation in markets and India’s growing role as a core pillar of BlackRock’s long-term strategy.

title: Gainers & Losers: Infosys, Eternal & Gokaldas Exports among 7 big movers on Wednesday
description: Nifty ended at 25,776, gaining 48.45 points or 0.19%, the BSE Sensex surged 78.56 points or 0.09% to Rs 83,817.69.

title: Uber shares in focus as Q4 revenue jumps 20%, led by food delivery; Q1 growth forecast weaker
description: Uber reported Q4 profit missed estimates and Q1 forecast was below expectations. Despite a revenue increase to $14.37 billion, net income dropped sharply to $296 million, influenced by equity investment revaluation. The company also announced a change in finance leadership.

title: Why silver’s monstrous rally may be a head fake
description: Before chasing the white metal’s rise, investors should take note of its past.

title: Shankar Sharma on the Indian stock market: Why medium-term returns may stay moderate
description: Ace investor Shankar Sharma believes that the Indian stock market may deliver moderate returns in the medium term. With a lack of fresh triggers and macroeconomic concerns, Sharma emphasises the need for cautious expectations despite a promising long-term outlook.

title: Sebi proposes overhaul of ‘fit and proper’ test for market intermediaries
description: The markets regulator has proposed doing away with automatic disqualifications over pending criminal complaints and charge sheets, saying these rules risk penalizing individuals and firms before wrongdoing is established.

title: Marico to acquire 60% stake in Cosmix Wellness for nearly  ₹226 crore — What investors should know
description: Marico will acquire a 60% stake in the food and nutrition company Cosmix Wellness for a consideration of  ₹226 crore as the FMCG giant aims to expand its presence in premium food and nutrition categories. Here's what investors should know.

title: US stock futures point to flat start for Wall Street after Anthropic AI-led tech selloff
description: The latest selloff in tech stocks was sparked by Anthropic after it said it was launching a new artificial intelligence (AI) tool servicing legal work, threatening software firms.

title: Tata Power Q3 results: Profit remains flat at  ₹1,194 crore, revenue falls 4% YoY
description: Tata Power Q3 results: Profit remained flat at  ₹1,194 crore, while revenue from operations for the quarter dropped 4% YoY to  ₹14,485 crore.

title: Grover Jewells IPO Day 1: Latest GMP, subscription status, listing date & other details about SME issue
description: Grover Jewells' IPO, which opened on January 28, was fully subscribed at 1.08 times, with strong interest from non-institutional and retail investors. The company aims to raise  ₹33.83 crore, with a price band of  ₹83 to  ₹88 per share.

title: Brandman Retail IPO booked 69% on Day 1; NIIs steal the show. Check GMP, issue details, more
description: Brandman Retail IPO, running from February 4 to February 6, is priced at  ₹167-176 per share. The company, founded in 2021, aims to enhance its retail footprint and working capital with the proceeds from the offering.

title: Fiscal realism and RBI patience: The new playbook for Indian bond investors
description: A well-constructed accrual-oriented portfolio that blends high-quality core holdings with measured doses of high-yield credit can potentially deliver superior risk-adjusted returns even in a flat yield environment.
